doc.name: StringSubstring
doc.description: Output a substring of the string provided at the input. The position of the substring within the input string is determined by the start and stop port parameters. Following Java convention, the character at start is included, but the character at stop is not. If the stop is less than start, then the substring starts at start and extends to the end of the string. The default values for start and stop are both 0; this results in an empty string at the output.
doc.author: Neil E. Turner and Edward A. Lee
doc.property: The beginning index of the input string, which is the position of first character of the desired substring. Its default value is 0, type int.
The ending index of the input string, which is 1 greater than the position of last letter of the desired substring. Its default value is 0, type int.
